isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - A/C REFRIGERANT LINE (ORIFICE LINE, INCLUDING CLUTCH CYCLING ORIFICE TUBE)

svcproc.title: A/C REFRIGERANT LINE (ORIFICE LINE, INCLUDING CLUTCH CYCLING ORIFICE TUBE)

caution.para: While handling the thermistor and the internal orifice tube in the following procedures, it is important to keep these components dirt free.

note.para: Refer to Figure 26 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Discharge the A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .
If necessary, remove right side splash panel. Refer to HOOD, GRILLE, and FENDERS section in GROUP 09- FRONT END SHEET METAL in the Master Service Manual.
Unclip clamp (1) securing condenser-to-evaporator A/C line (2) to evaporator housing.
Disconnect condenser-to-evaporator A/C line fitting from the orifice A/C line (3).
Disconnect clamp securing orifice line to evaporator housing.
Disconnect end of orifice line (3) connected to evaporator inlet fitting.
If necessary, remove and retain the thermistor (5) and the clamp from the A/C orifice line.

note.para: If the new orifice A/C line was supplied with an internal orifice tube and clamp installed, it is unnecessary to transfer those parts from the old orifice A/C line.

step1.para: Transfer the thermistor (5) and the clamp from the removed orifice line to the new orifice line (3).
Install a new internal clutch cycling orifice tube into the new orifice line (3).

step2.para: Insure that an O-ring is installed on the internal clutch cycling orifice tube (4).

note.para: The internal clutch cycling orifice tube is directional. The end of the orifice tube nearest to the O-ring must be inserted into the A/C line first.

step2.para: Lubricate the O-ring with refrigerant oil and install the internal clutch cycling orifice tube (4) into the orifice A/C line (3). A resistance will be felt when the O-ring is seated.

note.para: Always lubricate O-rings on fittings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para:
If the system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before reassembling the system. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.
Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect one end of orifice A/C line to the evaporator inlet fitting. Tighten to 20,000 ±1000 N.mm (180 ±10 lbf-in).
Secure orifice line to the evaporator housing using the clamp.
Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect condenser-to-evaporator line (2) to fitting on the end of the orifice A/C line. Tighten to 20,000 ±1000 N.mm (180 ±10 lbf-in).
Secure condenser-to-evaporator line to evaporator housing using mounting clip (1).
Install right side splash panel, if previously removed.
